BasicChoiceEvaluator

enspire.interactivity.evaluation.BasicEvaluator
enspire.interactivity.evaluation.IEvaluator
enspire.interactivity.evaluation.BasicChoiceEvaluator

The most basic class to evaluate choice-based activities.  This includes both multiple choice, and multiple select style questions.

This class returns an evaluation of type SimpleChoiceEvaluation in its evaluate() method.

Summary
BasicChoiceEvaluatorThe most basic class to evaluate choice-based activities.

BasicChoiceEvaluator

setMultipleSelect

addChoice

public function addChoice(c: IChoice)

This type of evaluator requires a bit of setup to ready it for use.  Specifically, we need to send it handles to all of the IChoice objects participating in this activity.

To see how this operates, see this code from the setupEvaluator() function in the SimpleMCController class.

Example usage

var i = 0;
 while(activityArgs["choice"+i] != undefined) {
     evaluator.addChoice(activityDisplay.getClip().choiceHolder["choice"+i]);
     i++;
 }

setTargetChoices

public function setTargetChoices(tc: Array)

This type of evaluator requires a bit of setup to ready it for use.  Specifically, we need to send it a data structure representing the ‘correct’ configuration of selected and unselected choices.

To see how this operates, see this code from the setupEvaluator() function in the SimpleMCController class.

Example usage

evaluator.setTargetChoices(activityArgs["correctChoices"].split(","));

evaluate

public function evaluate():IEvaluation

Returns a SimpleChoiceEvaluation representing the current state of the interactivity.

Really an abstract class.
Event that is dispatched from any Movie Clip that inherits from HotSpot when the standard mouse actions are performed on the clip.
